# Matplotlib boxplot

::: {.panel-tabset}

## Single boxplot 

We can make a single boxplot using `plt.boxplot()`

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

drug_1 = [98, 100, 97, 89, 92, 75]

survival_rates = [drug_1]

plt.boxplot(survival_rates)

plt.show()
```

## Multiple boxplots

We can plot multiple boxplots together by using a list of lists. 

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

drug_1 = [98, 100, 97, 89, 92, 75]
drug_2 = [76, 75, 88, 72, 67, 64]
drug_3 = [75, 88, 82, 69, 98, 54]

survival_rates = [drug_1, drug_2, drug_3]

plt.boxplot(survival_rates)

plt.show()
```

:::
